rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C101827

self.title: CDISC Questionnaire SF36 v2.0 Standard Test Name Terminology

definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 test name.
name: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 Questionnaire Test Name
preferredTerm: CDISC Questionnaire SF36 v2.0 Standard Test Name Terminology
synonyms: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 Questionnaire Test Name

terms.definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 - Bodily pain 0-100 score.
terms.preferredTerm: SF-36 v2.0 Standard - Bodily Pain 0-100 Score

terms.definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 - Bodily pain norm-based score.
terms.preferredTerm: SF-36 v2.0 Standard - Bodily Pain Norm-Based Score

terms.definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 - Compared to one year ago, how would you rate your health in general now?
terms.preferredTerm: SF-36 v2.0 Standard - Comp Year Ago Rate Gen Health Now
terms.submissionValue: SF363-Comp Year Ago Rate Gen Health Now
synonyms: SF363-Comp Year Ago Rate Gen Health Now

terms.definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 - Please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks - did you feel full of life.
terms.preferredTerm: SF-36 v2.0 Standard - Did You Feel Full of Life
terms.submissionValue: SF363-Did You Feel Full of Life
synonyms: SF363-Did You Feel Full of Life

terms.definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 - Please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks - did you feel tired.
terms.preferredTerm: SF-36 v2.0 Standard - Did You Feel Tired

terms.definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 - Please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks - did you feel worn out.
terms.preferredTerm: SF-36 v2.0 Standard - Did You Feel Worn Out

terms.definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 - Please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks - did you have a lot of energy.
terms.preferredTerm: SF-36 v2.0 Standard - Did You Have a Lot of Energy
terms.submissionValue: SF363-Did You Have a Lot of Energy
synonyms: SF363-Did You Have a Lot of Energy

terms.definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 - During the past 4 weeks, how much of the time have you had problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious) - accomplished less than you would like.
terms.preferredTerm: SF-36 v2.0 Standard - Emotional: Accomplished Less

terms.definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 - During the past 4 weeks, how much of the time have you had problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious) - cut down on the amount of time you spent on work or other activities.
terms.preferredTerm: SF-36 v2.0 Standard - Emotional: Cut Down Time on Work
terms.submissionValue: SF363-Emotional: Cut Down Time on Work
synonyms: SF363-Emotional: Cut Down Time on Work

terms.definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 - During the past 4 weeks, how much of the time have you had problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious) - did work or other activities less carefully than usual.
terms.preferredTerm: SF-36 v2.0 Standard - Emotional: Did Work Less Carefully

terms.definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 - During the past 4 weeks, to what extent has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your normal social activities with family, friends, neighbors, or groups?
terms.preferredTerm: SF-36 v2.0 Standard - Extent Phys/Emotional Interfered

terms.definition: The Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 - Please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks - have you felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer you up.
terms.preferredTerm: SF-36 v2.0 Standard - Felt Down Nothing Cheer You Up
terms.submissionValue: SF363-Felt Down Nothing Cheer You Up
synonyms: SF363-Felt Down Nothing Cheer You Up
